summary: Equal employment laws are intended to keep workplaces free of discrimination and harassment. The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission oversees federal agencies' compliance and also gives them guidance and training. Each year, agencies must assess their equal employment programs to find problems and plan for solutions. Agencies have to report this information to EEOC. But they don't always submit reports on time and EEOC doesn't track...
title: Equal Employment Opportunity Commission: Improved Oversight Processes Needed to Help Agencies Address Program Deficiencies
